title: Tombs of Amascut

properties.value: Tombs of Amascut is an upcoming raid set in the Kharidian Desert that was first announced during the Summer Summit in 2021, and is scheduled to release in early 2022. This will be the third raid released in Old School RuneScape, after the Chambers of Xeric and the Theatre of Blood. To participate in the raid, players will have to complete the Beneath Cursed Sands quest.

content:
This article or section contains information about a scheduled future release or update.
As such, the information is subject to change. This article should consist only of facts included in official Jagex releases and not speculation.
Remember: The Old School RuneScape Wiki is not a crystal ball.
Tombs of Amascut
Also called Raids 3, ToA
Released 2022 Q1 or Q2 - Update Unknown (edit)
Type Raid
Members Yes
Location Kharidian Desert
Participants 1-8
Skills Combat

Tombs of Amascut is an upcoming raid set in the Kharidian Desert that was first announced during the Summer Summit in 2021, and is scheduled to release in early 2022. This will be the third raid released in Old School RuneScape, after the Chambers of Xeric and the Theatre of Blood. To participate in the raid, players will have to complete the Beneath Cursed Sands quest.

Contents

  • 1 Mechanics
    • 1.1 Upper Level
    • 1.2 Lower Level
    • 1.3 Invocations
  • 2 Rewards
    • 2.1 Tumeken's heka
    • 2.2 Masori Armour set
    • 2.3 Elidinis' ward
    • 2.4 Lightbearer
    • 2.5 Osmumten's fang
    • 2.6 Keris Partisan
  • 3 Bosses

Mechanics[edit | edit source]

Tombs of Amascut can be played in groups of up to 8 players.

Upper Level[edit | edit source]

This area will consist of four initial challenges designed as "paths", with each one themed after one of Tumeken's avatars. Each path consists of a challenge section followed by a boss. These can be taken on in any order the player(s) choose to do so, however, as each path is completed the raid will change in various ways, making overall path choice matter. Once all four are completed, the lower level becomes accessible.

Lower Level[edit | edit source]

This area will consist of the final boss fight, which consists of two twin bosses that are to be fought simultaneously. Only after both bosses are defeated can players claim their rewards.

Invocations[edit | edit source]

Tombs of Amascut introduces Invocations, a "progressive, linear difficulty system". There will be no difficulty modes, rather, players can choose to enable various sets of Invocations that act as difficulty modifiers to the raid, thus making the raid easier or harder than the default difficulty. The rewards will scale based on the chosen Invocations.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Tumeken's heka[edit | edit source]

Main article: Tumeken's heka

A new powered wand requiring 85 Magic that will also be the first variable attack speed weapon. It will have an attack speed of 2 for the first three attacks, followed by a slower, more powerful fourth attack with a speed of 4. The faster attacks will scale to 50% of the player's Magic strength bonus, while the slower attack will scale to 150%. The wand will have a range of 6, with the long range setting increasing it to 8. The spells are built-in, requiring 3 Chaos runes and 1 Soul rune per charge.

Masori Armour set[edit | edit source]

A new Ranged armour set consisting of a helmet, a chestplate and a chainskirt. This armour can be upgraded with components obtained by breaking down Armadyl armour to make the best-in-slot Ranged armour.

Elidinis' ward[edit | edit source]

Main article: Elidinis' ward

A new best-in-slot Magic shield requiring 80 Magic, 80 Defence, and 80 Prayer that will be the first shield slot item to offer a universal Magic strength bonus. It will appear in a broken state requiring an arcane sigil and 10,000 Soul runes to repair. Doing so requires 90 Prayer and 90 Smithing. Alternatively, players without the required stats may pay Abbot Langley to repair the ward for 20,000,000 coins. Only the broken version of the ward will be tradeable. The repaired ward can be dismantled to retrieve the arcane sigil and broken ward, but the runes will be lost. A death in PvP will result as a dropped arcane sigil and broken ward.

Lightbearer[edit | edit source]

Main article: Lightbearer

A new ring that has no stats, but comes with a unique passive effect which regenerates Special attack energy twice as fast (will regenerate 10% energy every 15 seconds rather than every 30 seconds). Unequipping the ring resets this timer.

Osmumten's fang[edit | edit source]

Main article: Osmumten's fang

A new one-handed melee weapon requiring 82 Attack which excels primarily as a Stab weapon. It will have an attack speed of 5. The fang comes with a unique ability in which it calculates damage output differently from the standard roll: Instead of rolling for a value between 0 and the player's maximum possible hit, it will roll for a value between 15% and 85% of the player's maximum hit. For example, if a player's max hit is 60, it will roll for a value between 9 and 51 instead of 0 and 60. It has the highest accuracy bonus of any weapon, making it powerful and consistent against high Defence targets. It also comes with a Special attack which boosts its accuracy by 50% while allowing it to roll up to the player's true maximum hit instead of the 85% upper limit, effectively increasing the average hit of the weapon by 15%. The Special attack costs 50% Special attack energy to use.

Keris Partisan[edit | edit source]

Main article: Keris partisan

A new spear-like weapon requiring 70 Attack that is an upgrade to the Keris. It will have both Stab and Crush attack styles. The partisan will have a jewel socket into which players can insert various untradeable jewels obtained from the raid. Only one jewel can be used at a time. Each jewel bestows a different effect on the weapon. Some examples are:

  • Eye of the Corruptor: Adds a damage-over-time effect to attacked targets. This does not stack and can only be used within the raid.
  • Jewel of the Sun: Adds a debuff to attacked targets which increases their received damage for a short time. This can only be used within the raid.
  • Breach of the Scarab: Increases accuracy by 33% against Kalphites, Scarabs, and Beetles. This can be used anywhere.

Bosses[edit | edit source]

There are said to be 4 minor bosses, that must be faced, each one based on one of the minor gods created by Tumeken. The final boss is said to consist of 2 entities that must be defeated together.

  • Theatre of Blood
  • Tombs of Amascut

'''Tombs of Amascut''' is an [[Upcoming updates|upcoming]] [[raid]] set in the [[Kharidian Desert]] that was first announced during the Summer Summit in 2021, and is scheduled to release in early 2022. This will be the third raid released in ''Old School RuneScape'', after the [[Chambers of Xeric]] and the [[Theatre of Blood]]. To participate in the raid, players will have to complete the [[Beneath Cursed Sands]] [[quest]].

==Mechanics==
Tombs of Amascut can be played in groups of up to 8 players.

===Upper Level===
This area will consist of four initial challenges designed as "paths", with each one themed after one of [[Tumeken|Tumeken's]] avatars. Each path consists of a challenge section followed by a boss. These can be taken on in any order the player(s) choose to do so, however, as each path is completed the raid will change in various ways, making overall path choice matter. Once all four are completed, the lower level becomes accessible.

===Lower Level===
This area will consist of the final boss fight, which consists of two twin bosses that are to be fought simultaneously. Only after both bosses are defeated can players claim their rewards.

===Invocations===
Tombs of Amascut introduces Invocations, a "progressive, linear difficulty system". There will be no difficulty modes, rather, players can choose to enable various sets of Invocations that act as difficulty modifiers to the raid, thus making the raid easier or harder than the default difficulty. The rewards will scale based on the chosen Invocations.

==Rewards==
===Tumeken's heka===
{{main|Tumeken's heka}}
A new powered wand requiring 85 [[Magic]] that will also be the first variable attack speed weapon. It will have an attack speed of 2 for the first three attacks, followed by a slower, more powerful fourth attack with a speed of 4. The faster attacks will scale to 50% of the player's [[Magic Damage|Magic strength bonus]], while the slower attack will scale to 150%. The wand will have a range of 6, with the long range setting increasing it to 8. The spells are built-in, requiring 3 [[Chaos runes]] and 1 [[Soul rune]] per charge.

===Masori Armour set===
A new [[Ranged]] armour set consisting of a helmet, a chestplate and a chainskirt. This armour can be upgraded with components obtained by breaking down [[Armadyl armour]] to make the best-in-slot [[Ranged]] armour.

===Elidinis' ward===
{{main|Elidinis' ward}}
A new best-in-slot Magic shield requiring 80 Magic, 80 Defence, and 80 [[Prayer]] that will be the first [[shield slot]] item to offer a universal Magic strength bonus. It will appear in a broken state requiring an [[arcane sigil]] and 10,000 Soul runes to repair. Doing so requires 90 Prayer and 90 [[Smithing]]. Alternatively, players without the required stats may pay [[Abbot Langley]] to repair the ward for 20,000,000 [[coins]]. Only the broken version of the ward will be tradeable. The repaired ward can be dismantled to retrieve the arcane sigil and broken ward, but the runes will be lost. A death in [[PvP]] will result as a dropped arcane sigil and broken ward.

===Lightbearer===
{{main|Lightbearer}}
A new [[ring]] that has no stats, but comes with a unique passive effect which regenerates [[Special attack]] energy twice as fast (will regenerate 10% energy every 15 seconds rather than every 30 seconds). Unequipping the ring resets this timer.

===Osmumten's fang===
{{main|Osmumten's fang}}
A new one-handed melee weapon requiring 82 [[Attack]] which excels primarily as a [[Stab]] weapon. It will have an attack speed of 5. The fang comes with a unique ability in which it calculates damage output differently from the standard roll: Instead of rolling for a value between 0 and the player's maximum possible hit, it will roll for a value between 15% and 85% of the player's maximum hit. For example, if a player's max hit is 60, it will roll for a value between 9 and 51 instead of 0 and 60. It has the highest accuracy bonus of any weapon, making it powerful and consistent against high Defence targets. It also comes with a Special attack which boosts its accuracy by 50% while allowing it to roll up to the player's true maximum hit instead of the 85% upper limit, effectively increasing the average hit of the weapon by 15%. The Special attack costs 50% Special attack energy to use.

===Keris Partisan===
{{main|Keris partisan}}
A new spear-like weapon requiring 70 Attack that is an upgrade to the [[Keris]]. It will have both Stab and [[Crush]] attack styles. The partisan will have a jewel socket into which players can insert various untradeable jewels obtained from the raid. Only one jewel can be used at a time. Each jewel bestows a different effect on the weapon. Some examples are:
* Eye of the Corruptor: Adds a damage-over-time effect to attacked targets. This does not stack and can only be used within the raid.
* Jewel of the Sun: Adds a debuff to attacked targets which increases their received damage for a short time. This can only be used within the raid.
* Breach of the Scarab: Increases accuracy by 33% against [[Kalphites]], [[Scarabs]], and Beetles. This can be used anywhere.

==Bosses==
There are said to be 4 minor bosses, that must be faced, each one based on one of the minor gods created by [[Tumeken]]. The final boss is said to consist of 2 entities that must be defeated together.
